Reviews.Title: “clean but old...”
Reviews.Author: Behnaz_80
Reviews.Content: i think the most important thing about a hotel is its cleanness... and thanks god that our room was clean, and every day we had room service. the man in reception was rough and communicating with him was very hard (unfortunately he just knew turkish!). breakfasts was not bad. dining room was always noisy but some of staffs there were kind and helpful. in the bathroom there was a shower that we had problem with it. it was so strange! . but we loved its location... it was far from the center and taqsim square but fortunately near tram station and one of the best transports in istanbul is tram which u can go every where you want. totally i liked its place...

Reviews.Title: “a 2star hotel instead of 4star”
Reviews.Author: radishco
Reviews.Content: this hotel far from bazaar and citycenter. small rooms and very small refrigerator. very bad bathroom. water of pool was very cold for sweeming. but good breakfast self service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!”
Reviews.Author: syloft
Reviews.Content: This is our first night in Turkey following a group tour and what a nightmare it was to stay in this hotel after a 10+ hours flight. The room looked tired and worn. Decor and furnitures are aging and in need of a change. Our room faces the main road which is rather noisy. We did not have a good night's sleep as the mattress is uncomfortable and the blankets provided were rather small. The bathroom is in a rather disastrous state too. The water tap and shower systems are rusting and the shower system is one which requires much fiddling around to understand how to operate. Warning! Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xfive_L
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner was not working, I complained three times and nothing was done about it. The staff are not helpfull at all. I hated every minute I spent in this hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE, YOU WILL HATE IT

Reviews.Title: “Never to even think of it”
Reviews.Author: Vikas505
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in group of 53 people. On first day only the problem of water in toilets was there which was there for rest of the time also. The staff was totally non-cooperative and they never tried to understand what we are saying. The food quality was aaaaaaaaaaaaaa. They even charged for using GYM which is always complimentary. I will never ever stay there in future nor recommend to anyone else. The air conditioning was totally not working. Some rooms were evern smaller than bathrooms in our house. The breakfast which was being served was having only 4-5 items and that also not fresh.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where the abysmal was the norm”
Reviews.Author: MaureenDerby
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly, unhelpful, uncommunicative staff (bar one lady on reception and room maid). Pitch black corridors until lights operated by movement came on - too late and for too short a time. Only one unscrambled TV channel, in Turkish. Swimming pool franchised out, 2 floors below ground level, small, dark, hot and cost Â£5 per day for residents. Restaurant gloomy, poor quality, food cold when should be hot, bizarre selection (i.e., always previous nights reheated soup at breakfast), very sparse choice, not even limited English spoken. Shower more ambitious in style than efficient in operation. Room clean enough, but decor and furnishings poor. Rating should be 2* at best. Temperamental lift. Requests/complaints for action ignored or delayed, i.e., when a light bulb failed, promises but no action in the 60 hours before we left for home. Early call did not happen, messages did not get passed on. Only good point was the fast tram route outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, past it's best.”
Reviews.Author: Titania68 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a Titan tour and 2 nights at the end. What a relief that in spite of the BA strike we were able to fly home on time! The rooms were grubby and the carpets and bathroom floor had ingrained dirt. The furniture was flimsy and the much lauded showers in the hotel information were in fact moulded units which dented in when pushed and were difficult to operate. The lifts were unreliable and were apt to plunge into complete darkness and stick in one place. When we reported the inter-room telephone did not operate, we were met with a shrug and "the exchange must be busy. Not true as we could not contact another room all the time we were there. We feel that Titan really should be ashamed to put their customers into this hotel and our confidence in the tour company has sadly diminished since this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel - definitely not woth its stars or your money.”
Reviews.Author: sslmmm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights as part of a Titan trip to Turkey. It was not a good start to the trip as the hotel decor is interesting, to say the least, with an excess of faded gold everywhere. The lifts are sometimes unresponsive; the rooms small and somewhat dirty; the bathroom has a shower unit that defies operation unless you have a guided tour; there were bare wires in the room; the cover to the main light fitting was missing; breakfast was adequate but uninspiring and petered out after 9.00. There was no information about anything in the faded folder left on the desk. The TV did not work. Given this was the start and finish of the holiday I think Titan took their eye off the ball and corporate greed took over which resultefd in masive corner cutting. This hotel did not match with the promises in the brochure or its claimed 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD RATED 2 STARS INSTEAD OF 4”
Reviews.Author: HKFOOD
Reviews.Content: The airports in UK was closed so we have to stay in Istanbul till the airports open again. I booked the hotel through the hotel booking services in the airport. The pictures look very nice on the computer. The hotel got swimming pool, sauna and spa facilities. 320 Euros for 2 nights in a two bed room suite seems reasonable. They said it is a suite with 2 double beds. When we checked in, it is a bit like the Faulty Towers. The rooms are basic and bare. TV and fridge looks like from the 80'. The suite have one old double bed and a old uncomfortable sofa bed instead of 2 double beds. The hotel menu in the so called "suite" is empty. The only telephone in the suite with no directory of what number to dail for reception, housekeeping.................etc. The swimming pool in the basement looks a bit dark and not very clean. I have no intention to go in with my family after we saw the pool. It wil still cost us 5 euro each if we want to use the pool. We did phoned up the reception more than 3 times and waited for over an hour when we asked for an extra pillow. Not to mention the missing quilt for the sofa bed. We checked out the next day because we can not bare to stay for another day.

Reviews.Title: “Not safe to stay in this hotel AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravel75
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel that you should not consider to stay at all. The security of in-house guest are not being guaranteed. Their room control system is totally messy. When their hotel is running full house, they will simply issue key card to guest who check in. My incidence was that when we enter to the room, there are still previous guest luggages inside the room. We report the case to the reception, they re-issue another key card to us. This time was worst. The new room that they assign, there are still guest inside the room taking shower. Another one round of hassle, we change the room. The story end by given us a room that are not functionable. The toilet bowl is not attached to the floor, the whole bathroom was wet. I have been travelling so many places but had never been experience such a bad service hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Not really our cup of cay!”
Reviews.Author: smallworld44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Hill for three nights in October as part of a study trip to Turkey and Cyprus. Istanbul is a wonderful city, and the Golden Hill wasn't bad, but there were several problems. The hotel is on the main road (traffic all night) and as we had a road-facing room, a good night's sleep was not possible. The room was OK, but very shabby, the bathroom could have been nice if more attention had been paid to cleanliness! Breakfast was fine, with a wide selection of food, but the two evening meals we had were nothing to write home about. One evening there was rice and a type of stew. My husband and I are vegetarians, so we were offered just two heaps of rice with no accompaniment whatsoever! The waiters seemed to have a problem understanding that there are people who don't eat meat! Drinks taken at the horel are extremely expensive! Including one or two other little 'moans', these are the negative aspects of the hotel. On the positive side, the staff - especially the waiters in the dining room - were very friendly and helpful. The area around the hotel is not particularly attractive, but full of life; we found a good barber's shop round the corner and a nice bar. There is a down-the-steps bar city-wards on the same road as the hotel, but beware! the prices are exorbitant! OUR little bar (out of the hotel door to the left, then first road on the left) was great! All in all, I don't think I would really want to recommend this hotel, as I am sure there are others at the price that are more attractive to visitors to the city. However, it wasn't too far away from tjhe sights, and for three nights it was just about acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: noelkity
Reviews.Content: quite surprised when informed that each of us (5) would have to pay TYL 10 every visit if we wanted to use the checkers board, the swimming pool, health club or watch the television in the leisure area.

Reviews.Title: “Not as described”
Reviews.Author: eljoanda
Reviews.Content: We had 2 different rooms here over 5 nights and neither had hair dryer,ironing board,safe as advertised.Fridge in one didnt work, nor air conditioner in other effective.Shower didnt drain properly,general room maintenance lacking and not really clean.No a la carte when we were there and didnt see TV room as mentioned,bar nearly alwasy seemed empty and closed.Service was indifferent .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely reasonable for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Nobodi
Reviews.Content: It is a new hotel with very clean but small rooms. Its good location let you get anywhere by tram which only cost you 1.4 YTL. Good breakfast and I particularly enjoyed high speed wifi internet in the Lobby Everything is good and reasonable but there are jsut some points which we didn't care but you may as I mentioned below: There is no bar in the room but you can order (the refrigerator is empty and they just put two small mineral water during our one week stay)! There is no water boiler in room but you can order tea or coffee. There is no waste bin in the room (there is one in the toilet)! There wasn't any hotel telephone guide in the room and you must call "0" and the reception will arrange for everything! The TV channels was noisy and there wasn't many clear TV channels (only 3 or 4 as I remember). And finally they don't have scale to weigh baggage! I hoped they could also offer wifi in the rooms but they didn't. However, we (me and my wife) are satisfied stayed there and I hope they could also figure out the mentioned problems! And finally just to say thanks I registered their website url in the google and also located the hotel in Wikimapia which they didn't do before and I had problem to find enough information about them on web when my travel agent offer them to us. http://www.goldenhill.com.tr/

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel a bit away from the fray”
Reviews.Author: Laleh2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently built and obviously designed by a man ;-): the shower was so complicated to run we had to ask the hotel desk to come and explain and while it all was very designy, it was also a bit cold (no pictures on the wall, especially in the breakfast room, which could have been a bit cheerier). However, the heating system worked like a charm and the double-glazed windows shut out the noise relatively effectively. The hotel is located on a busy throughfare with a tram which brings you directly to the Old Town, which is super convenient. The immediate surroundings are ok, whilst no great shakes but plenty of kebab shops and pretty safe, even at night, although travelers should be warned that there is a bit of red light stuff going on -- but all pretty benign. Personnel was quite helpful but did not speak a lot of English. Breakfast was quite boring with the same thing every day. The swimming pool was out of commission when we came but that seemed to be the case with most other hotels which advertised pools. Maybe there is not enough water -- in fact, there was one occasion when the water seemed to be quite low but this is not the hotel's fault -- Istanbul is growing at a crazy pace and the infrastructure has a hard time keeping up. The hotel lobby is very pretty and bright )unlike many other hotels we saw which seemed to be more or less in the same class)-- kudos to the hotel for getting that right. However, it would be even better if you could have drink there but that did not seem possible. Overall facit: would recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Hill Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Millet Cad No 104 | Findikzadi, Istanbul 34093, Turkey
